DataElement.preferredDefinition: Location of lesion geographic epicenter; the largest component of the tumor (either CET or nCET).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change._That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions._Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/16/11 - upd for VASARI 3.0 Key (1/14/2011); DEC released.  6/22/09 used by VASARI F1 feature item

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon._Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the brain located anterior to the parietal lobes at the front of each cerebral hemisphere.

Concepts.definition: The part of the brain located anterior to the parietal lobes at the front of each cerebral hemisphere.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 5.13.21 Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lower lateral part of the cerebral hemisphere.

Concepts.definition: One of the cerebral lobes. It is located inferior to the frontal and parietal lobes and anterior to the occipital lobe.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An invaginated portion of the cerebral cortex forming the base of the sylvian fissure.  It is part of the lateral side of the cortex and its function includes the processing of emotions, memory, and higher autonomic control.

Concepts.definition: An invaginated portion of the cerebral cortex forming the base of the sylvian fissure.  It is part of the lateral side of the cortex and its function includes the processing of emotions, memory, and higher autonomic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the lobes of the cerebral hemisphere located superiorly to the occipital lobe and posteriorly to the frontal lobe. Cognition and visuospatial processing are its main functions.

Concepts.definition: One of the lobes of the cerebral hemisphere located superiorly to the occipital lobe and posteriorly to the frontal lobe. Cognition and visuospatial processing are its main functions.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 5.26.21 Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the four regions of cortex in each cerebral hemisphere. It is located posterior to the temporal lobe and inferior to the parietal lobe.

Concepts.definition: One of the four regions of cortex in each cerebral hemisphere. It is located posterior to the temporal lobe and inferior to the parietal lobe.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 5.26.21 Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the brain that is connected to the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: Three sections, the midbrain, pons and medulla oblongata, that are located at the base of the brain. The brain stem regulates the central nervous system, and is vital as a conduit for motor and sensory innervations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection.:Named locations of, or within, the body.
